t: John 20
The Empty Tomb
Early*p on the first day of the week, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene went to the tomb and saw that the stone had been removed from the entrance.
So she came running to Simon Peter and the other disciple, the one Jesus loved, and said, “They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we don’t know where they have put him!”
So*p Peter and the other disciple started for the tomb.
Both were running, but the other disciple outran Peter and reached the tomb first.
He bent over and looked in at the strips of linen lying there but did not go in.
Then Simon Peter came along behind him and went straight into the tomb. He saw the strips of linen lying there,
as well as the cloth that had been wrapped around Jesus’ head. The cloth was still lying in its place, separate from the linen.
Finally the other disciple, who had reached the tomb first, also went inside. He saw and believed.
(They still did not understand from Scripture that Jesus had to rise from the dead.)
Then the disciples went back to where they were staying.
Jesus Appears to Mary Magdalene
Now*p Mary stood outside the tomb crying. As she wept, she bent over to look into the tomb
and saw two angels in white, seated where Jesus’ body had been, one at the head and the other at the foot.
They*p asked her, “Woman, why are you crying?” “They*p have taken my Lord away,” she said, “and I don’t know where they have put him.”
At this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, but she did not realize that it was Jesus.

He*p asked her, “Woman,*r why*r are*r you*r crying?*r Who*r is*r it*r you*r are*r looking*r for?”*r Thinking*p he was the gardener, she said, “Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have put him, and I will get him.”
Jesus*p said to her, “Mary.”*r She*p turned toward him and cried out in Aramaic, “Rabboni!” (which means “Teacher”).

Jesus*p said, “Do*r not*r hold*r on*r to*r me,*r for*r I*r have*r not*r yet*r ascended*r to*r the*r Father.*r Go*r instead*r to*r my*r brothers*r and*r tell*r them,*r ‘I*r am*r ascending*r to*r my*r Father*r and*r your*r Father,*r to*r my*r God*r and*r your*r God.’ ”*r
Mary*p Magdalene went to the disciples with the news: “I have seen the Lord!” And she told them that he had said these things to her.
Jesus Appears to His Disciples

On*p the evening of that first day of the week, when the disciples were together, with the doors locked for fear of the Jewish leaders, Jesus came and stood among them and said, “Peace*r be*r with*r you!”*r
After he said this, he showed them his hands and side. The disciples were overjoyed when they saw the Lord.
Again*p Jesus said, “Peace*r be*r with*r you!*r As*r the*r Father*r has*r sent*r me,*r I*r am*r sending*r you.”*r
And with that he breathed on them and said, “Receive*r the*r Holy*r Spirit.*r
If*r you*r forgive*r anyone’s*r sins,*r their*r sins*r are*r forgiven;*r if*r you*r do*r not*r forgive*r them,*r they*r are*r not*r forgiven.”*r
Jesus Appears to Thomas
Now*p Thomas (also known as Didymus), one of the Twelve, was not with the disciples when Jesus came.

So the other disciples told him, “We have seen the Lord!” But*p he said to them, “Unless I see the nail marks in his hands and put my finger where the nails were, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe.”
A*p week later his disciples were in the house again, and Thomas was with them. Though the doors were locked, Jesus came and stood among them and said, “Peace*r be*r with*r you!”*r
Then he said to Thomas, “Put*r your*r finger*r here;*r see*r my*r hands.*r Reach*r out*r your*r hand*r and*r put*r it*r into*r my*r side.*r Stop*r doubting*r and*r believe.”*r
Thomas*p said to him, “My Lord and my God!”
Then*p Jesus told him, “Because*r you*r have*r seen*r me,*r you*r have*r believed;*r blessed*r are*r those*r who*r have*r not*r seen*r and*r yet*r have*r believed.”*r
The Purpose of John’s Gospel
Jesus*p performed many other signs in the presence of his disciples, which are not recorded in this book.
But these are written that you may believe that Jesus is the Messiah, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in his name.
